This page provides installing on how to install QtTube on Ubuntu Gutsy 7.10.

=== Installing QtTube 0.2~pre1: The fast way ===

Execute the following code in a terminal and it will do everything needed to get QtTube 0.2~pre1 working: install the dependencies, download the source, install QtTube and create a entry in the menu. (If you execute this you don't need to continue reading the other sections of this page.)

<pre>
sudo aptitude -y install python-qt4 youtube-dl && wget https://edge.launchpad.net/qttube/0.x/0.2/+download/QtTube-0.2~pre1.tar.gz --no-check-certificate && gunzip ./QtTube-0.2~pre1.tar.gz && tar -xvvf QtTube-0.2~pre1.tar && rm ./QtTube-0.2~pre1.tar && cd ./qttube-0.2~pre1 && sudo ./install "/usr/local"
</pre>

<pre>
sudo cp ./data/qttube.desktop /usr/share/applications && sudo cp ./data/qttube-48x48.png /usr/share/pixmaps/qttube.png && sudo ln /usr/local/QtTube/qttube /usr/local/bin/qttube && cd .. && rm ./qttube-0.2~pre1 -r
</pre> 

''Note you will need to have the "universe" repository enabled.''

=== Getting the dependencies ===

<pre>
sudo aptitude -y install python-qt4 youtube-dl
</pre>

''Note you will need to have the "universe" repository enabled.''

=== Running or Installing QtTube ===

Once you have installed the dependencies, you can run and/or install QtTube following the <nowiki>[[QtTube/Installation|common instructions]]</nowiki> for GNU/Linux.
